column4: i just installed ubuntu, i am new to the linux community, and i am having trouble connecting to my dsl modem, can anybody help ?
nothing actually, i click on the firefox application and i get the ubuntu documentation page, i cant access any websites
i went into network settings and tried to tinker with it, it wont let me connect
why not call your isp and ask them how to use their service on linux ?
how did you connect on windows ?
i just plug it into the ethernet port and it connects
no
and that works even after you reinstall windows ? or do you have to set something up ?
its not windows
my windows box is fine, im on it right now
its my ubuntu computer
i just installed ubuntu on one of my computers
im new to linux
i am just asking because if you need to set up something on your windows, you need to set up the same thing on linux
i plugged in my ethernet cable from my dsl modem
as i ususally do with my windows box
and it wont connect
so i went into network settings
enebled my ethernet connection, and still nothing
k hang on lets see what happens
it asks me for ip subnet and gateway
can i get those from ipconfig on my windows computer which is plugged into the same modem ?
ok hang on
actually you don't have to get them from windows, you can just set dhcp
